node.excerpt: Summer term began on Monday 20 April and will end on Saturday 13 June 2020.

frontmatter.title: What are the dates for summer term 2020?

node.excerpt: Programme delivery by Schools and Depts will start on Monday 27 April. We will then teach for five weeks; this will allow us to make up for the week we missed by bringing forward the Easter Vacation. All teaching will end by Friday 29 May.

frontmatter.title: When will programme delivery start?

node.excerpt: The Assessment Period will run from 1 – 19 June ; term will officially end on Friday 19 June. All programmes being offered during this current academic year will have forms of assessment that can be undertaken off-campus and indeed outside the UK.  There will be no assessment tasks for the remainder of this academic year that will require you to be on campus.

frontmatter.title: When will the Assessment Period run from?

node.excerpt: Subject to government advice, we plan to make our on-campus Student Services available for students during the summer term, even though teaching for that term will take place online.  Any changes to the current operating hours or processes for these services will be communicated on this page or via your University email.

frontmatter.title: Will I be able to access Student Services during the summer term?

node.excerpt: The ongoing University-level discussions around assessments include the supplementary examination period, when it should be, what assessments will be expected, and so forth. It is highly likely that any supplementary assessment will be delivered virtually. Please do not worry, and await further communication from us.

frontmatter.title: I failed a module, will my re-sit still be taking place in August, and will it be delivered online?

node.excerpt: Yes, all the decisions communicated to date are applicable to your teaching. Assessment will need to be considered on an individual basis, and your Faculty will be in contact with you separately to discuss the assessment that you will need to complete.
